body:
I had a huge detailed reply to this. instead, I'm just going to make a few small points:

* If we make a major change to the UA, it should not receive another major change until 7.0.0
* I am against a major change, but open to minor improvements
* UA is one thing that you absolutely should discard the RFC in favor of doing what everyone else is doing or you are going to have a bad time
* I am absolutely against a static UA for all platforms.
* I want to see a detailed piece-by-piece analysis of what exactly is wrong with the current UA, because, as far as I can tell we are already doing it right by keeping a small variation of the historical UA from 5.1 and older. 
* "This makes it impossible for site developers to manage responses." Is absolutely not true as servers are already using the UA in 5.1 and older and the current one is only a slight variation

5.1:

```
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT; Windows NT 10.0; en-US) WindowsPowerShell/5.1.15063.674
```

6.0.0-beta.9 Windows:

```none
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Microsoft Windows 10.0.15063; en-US) PowerShell/6.0.0
```

6.0.0-beta.9 Linux:
```none
Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Linux 4.4.0-96-generic #119-Ubuntu SMP Tue Sep 12 14:59:54 UTC 2017; en-US) PowerShell/6.0.0
```

6.0.0-beta.9 macOS:
```none
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Darwin 17.0.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.0.0: Thu Aug 24 21:48:19 PDT 2017; root:xnu-4570.1.46~2/RELEASE_X86_64; ) PowerShell/6.0.0
```
